ai.summary: ACW Circular Walk 05 is a demanding long-distance circuit in the UK, covering 38.4 km with rugged, varied terrain that tests endurance and navigation.
ai.terrain_summary: The route features a mix of country lanes, rough trails, boggy moorland, rocky ascents, and forest tracks. Expect exposed sections, uneven ground, and limited shelter in parts, with mud common in wetter conditions.
ai.safety_notes: This is a hard, long hike requiring good navigation and weather preparedness. Plan for a full day or more, check forecast, and start early in daylight. Carry a map and compass (or GPS), a fully charged phone as backup, and know your escape routes. Bring adequate clothing for rain and cold, extra food and water, a first aid kit, and an emergency blanket. Be cautious of boggy sections, sudden weather changes, and fatigue; turn back if conditions worsen or visibility drops,
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with ankle support
Breathable layering system (base layer, insulating layer, outer shell)
Backpack 20–30 L capacity with rain cover
Map and compass (or GPS) and fully charged phone as backup
Water bottles or hydration system (2–3 L total)
High-energy snacks and a portable stove if needed
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
First aid kit tailored to long hikes
Trekking poles (optional but helpful on rough sections)
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May to September) typically offer the most reliable conditions and daylight in the UK; spring can be muddier and autumn can be wetter and windier.

seo.title: ACW Circular Walk 05 – 38.4 km Hard UK Circular Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover ACW Circular Walk 05, a challenging 38.4 km loop in the UK. This guide covers terrain, safety tips, and gear for a hard long-distance hike.
seo.h1: ACW Circular Walk 05 — 38.4 km hard circular hike in the UK
